page.title: 17SCHOOLS IN WESTBURY
page.content: The town is served by three schools to which most children go. They start in the term in which they become five at Laverton Infants School in Eden Vale Road where they stay until they are 7+. Headmistress Mrs. J.M.Banner. The children usually then go to Westbury C.E. Junior School on an adjoining site in Oldfield Park. Built in 1958 it has seven classrooms,a hall and kitchen. There are 5 temporary classrooms to help house the 280 pupils including a special unit for children with mild learning difficulties: Headmaster Mr.F.A.Beeby. The Matravers School in Springfield Road takes children at 11+. There has been a school on the site since 1844.Development and expansion was completed in 1974 and it now has 900 pupils under 16. Headmaster Mr.K.Evans
